intro: Dyschoriste miskatensis, commonly known as the Miskatensis dyschoriste, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the arid regions of North Africa, particularly Morocco and Algeria. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit, with narrow, hairy leaves and showy, pale pink to purple flowers. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
